channel.title: Happy Independence Day!
channel.description:
July 4th is the day us Americans celebrate declaring independence from oppressive England in 1776. America then proceeded to kick the most powerful empire of the day out of the country with an army mainly composed of militia against an army of British regulars and Hessian mercenaries.
We generally celebrate this day by shooting off fireworks and sometimes our guns, and having cookouts, bonfires and the like.
Anyway, Happy 4th y'all! :D
[img]http://www.highlandsprings-nc.com/assets/images/These_Colors_Don_t_Run-07-A.jpg[/img]

item.title: Happy Independence Day!
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“cooper, post:61, topic:347304”][quote author=Frell link=topic=443681.msg3260009#msg3260009 date=1278428514]

And everything after that including saving your ass in WW2 led us to be come the most powerful military force in the world ;).

You mean losing to a bunch of people that were taking a shit in the jungle and joining 2 wars later than everyone else makes you the most powerful? Personally I think it has something to do with spending the most on your military, which is still about 4 times more than china and the uk combined but whatever floats your boat I guess.

We won Vietnam, it was counted as a loss when after we left they switched back to communism again.
[/quote]
That’s not what happened.[/quote]
Blah blah blah the south Vietnamese couldn’t support democracy so communists got ahold of it again.

item.title: Happy Independence Day!
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:56, topic:347304”][quote author=Radeon link=topic=443681.msg3259973#msg3259973 date=1278425550]
Many of the soldiers I saw had beer bellies but their arms and chests were all very built.
[/quote]
Well what’s your definition of ‘beer belly’? Anything above the 10% bodyfat mark is going to lack a perpetual 6-pack look. The abs become visible at around the 12% mark iirc, but only when you flex. For the 6 pack look all day every day you’d need to probably sit at around 6% to 8% bodyfat.
tl;dr: Anyone at 15% - 20% is going to have a belly to some extent, and they certainly won’t have the ripped look that someone in the single digits has.

EDIT: This video is cool: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sbFGdpQD_O0 – There’s a video of Jesse Marunde doing a set of 20 squats too, and it’s insane. If you can man up and do a heavy set of 20, you can probably do anything.
Case in point though: The guy in the video I’ve linked to looks as if he has a beer belly, but odds are he’d fuck you all up when it comes to endurance, strength, and power.[/quote]

They were pretty much like that guy, some had a bit more. A six pac is almost entirely cosmetic.

Read full topic

item.title: Happy Independence Day!
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:56, topic:347304”][quote author=Radeon link=topic=443681.msg3259973#msg3259973 date=1278425550]
Many of the soldiers I saw had beer bellies but their arms and chests were all very built.
[/quote]
Well what’s your definition of ‘beer belly’? Anything above the 10% bodyfat mark is going to lack a perpetual 6-pack look. The abs become visible at around the 12% mark iirc, but only when you flex. For the 6 pack look all day every day you’d need to probably sit at around 6% to 8% bodyfat.
tl;dr: Anyone at 15% - 20% is going to have a belly to some extent, and they certainly won’t have the ripped look that someone in the single digits has.

EDIT: This video is cool: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sbFGdpQD_O0 – There’s a video of Jesse Marunde doing a set of 20 squats too, and it’s insane. If you can man up and do a heavy set of 20, you can probably do anything.
Case in point though: The guy in the video I’ve linked to looks as if he has a beer belly, but odds are he’d fuck you all up when it comes to endurance, strength, and power.[/quote]
Soldiers aren’t always guaranteed to eat though, so they need a good amount of body fat.

Read full topic

item.title: Happy Independence Day!
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Radeon:

Many of the soldiers I saw had beer bellies but their arms and chests were all very built.

Well what’s your definition of ‘beer belly’? Anything above the 10% bodyfat mark is going to lack a perpetual 6-pack look. The abs become visible at around the 12% mark iirc, but only when you flex. For the 6 pack look all day every day you’d need to probably sit at around 6% to 8% bodyfat.
tl;dr: Anyone at 15% - 20% is going to have a belly to some extent, and they certainly won’t have the ripped look that someone in the single digits has.

EDIT: This video is cool: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sbFGdpQD_O0 – There’s a video of Jesse Marunde doing a set of 20 squats too, and it’s insane. If you can man up and do a heavy set of 20, you can probably do anything.
Case in point though: The guy in the video I’ve linked to looks as if he has a beer belly, but odds are he’d fuck you all up when it comes to endurance, strength, and power.

Read full topic

item.title: Happy Independence Day!
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“Cowie`, post:52, topic:347304”][quote author=Frell link=topic=443681.msg3259079#msg3259079 date=1278361132]
Theres physical limitations to who can go into the military. gj Idiet
[/quote]

http://usmilitary.about.com/od/armyjoin/l/blintweightmale.htm your soldiers are fucking fat.[/quote]
What the fuck? I’m 70 inches tall, and if I read that chart correctly then ideally I should weigh no more than 192 lbs (or 87kg). If I do then I’ll be subject to bodyfat percentage testing. The minimum weight, 123 lbs or 55kg, is obviously only achievable by females at that height, and slim ones at that.

Admittedly they are a little relaxed with the bodyfat percentage ceilings. In my opinion, I think about 15 - 17% bodyfat is ideal because if you’re infantry, for example, then you could spend weeks in arduous conditions outside in little more than an encampment.
With that said, how many fatties (ie, people pushing the 20% to 25% bodyfat) have you actually seen serving in any American force?
In any footage I’ve seen there haven’t been any.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: Happy Independence Day!
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

They base it off BMI to an extent. People at high BMI have their bodyfat percentage measured, and if it’s too high (ie, they’re fatties) then they get told to lose weight, maintain their reduced weight for a minimum of 6 months, and then come back.
The reason that heavier is better in the army is that a lot of the lighter guys have a bit of trouble with recoil from larger weapons, among other things.

Read full topic

item.title: Happy Independence Day!
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Frell:

And everything after that including saving your ass in WW2 led us to be come the most powerful military force in the world ;).

You mean losing to a bunch of people that were taking a shit in the jungle and joining 2 wars later than everyone else makes you the most powerful? Personally I think it has something to do with spending the most on your military, which is still about 4 times more than china and the uk combined but whatever floats your boat I guess.

[quote=“Frell, post:29, topic:347304”]All they did was stand in a line and get shot…

weeeeee[/quote]

That’s how we roll man, who needs to get all dirty then die when you can just stand up and die anyway?

Moparisthebest:

The americans learned how to fight from the indians, the british just refused to fight that way and payed for it.

I was watching a documentary which basically blamed it on the Europeans being so used to standing in lines firing at each other until the last man stood. Surprisingly it was about French colonials having to learn Canadian natives(iirc) tactics to survive, made by Americans. I have a similar view, I mean if it wasn’t for the Chinese finding gun powder and changing warfare forever, we’d all still be fighting with crossbows and swords on horseback after all.

Lothy:

I also learned that Americans fighting the British were possibly the first people in the world to employ guerrilla warfare tactics

Wasn’t it originally the native Americans(or whatever native tribes from around the world you want) who originally used such tactics as observed by Europeans? Us eurofags obviously weren’t the only people on the earth pre new world.

Lothy:

they must have really hated the British.

Still do, even from a young age and such everyone jokes about hating on the French and such.

la­wl:

why does everything turn into boring political debate

dunno, welcome to 4chmoparisthebest.com !

Lothy:

Soldiers should be bigger to an extent. Not fat, but certainly built (and therefore heavy). The Australian Army accepts people with a BMI of something like 33 and lower. Theoretically, at 178cm tall I could get in with a maximum weight of 105kg or less. For someone that isn’t 6 foot tall, that is extremely built (ie, built like a brick shithouse) assuming bodyfat is 15% or lower.

Accepting by bmi is pretty bad and I bet they don’t do that but still, bmi offers no indication other than basic height/weight(obviously 33 being built like a fucking tank from l4d or extremely fat).

I’m 24 or 25 bmi but most of that is pure lard. Feels good man.

Sorry about contributing to the trolling but it’s gotta be done I kid obviously, we should just make a “guns vs no guns, drugs vs no drugs, americans vs eurofags” thread and put all the trolling in this hypothetical super-thread… hint hint wink wink

I hope all you Americans had a good time and got to see some nice firework displays !!

Read full topic
